articles.title: Kim Jong Il's China Visit Hailed
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's China Visit Hailed
Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- Leading papers here today editorially congratulate General Secretary Kim Jong Il on his successful historic China visit. They say that his visit was an epoch-making event that would shine long in the history of the DPRK-China friendship.
					 Rodong Sinmun says that his visit to China marked a significant occasion in further deepening the friendly feelings and comradely fraternity forged between the top leaders of the two parties and two countries. It goes on:
					
					 His latest China visit strikingly demonstrated the vitality of the DPRK-China friendship further developed last year, a "year of DPRK-China friendship".
					
					 His visit infused great pleasure and encouragement into the two peoples desirous of consolidating the bonds of bilateral friendship and steadily and vigorously developing the bilateral ties in the new century.
					
					 The visit, a historic event that recorded a shining chapter in the annals of the DPRK-China friendship, will greatly contribute to giving a powerful impetus to the sacred struggle of the two peoples for socialist construction and national reunification, achieving the peace and security in Northeast Asia including the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world, strengthening the unity and cooperation among the progressive people aspiring after independence and advancing the human cause of independence against imperialism.
					
					 The Korean people are convinced that the Chinese people will build a comprehensively well-off society and make great progress in the efforts to reunify the whole country. The Korean people are rejoiced as over their own over the successes being made in China and extend firm support and solidarity to the just cause of the Chinese people.
					
					 The parties, governments and peoples of the two countries have actively spurred the DPRK-China friendly and cooperative relations, setting store by them. The Chinese party and government have always extended disinterested support to the just cause of the Korean people. The Korean people feel thankful for it.
					
					 The long-standing bilateral friendship with excellent tradition is growing stronger thanks to the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 The Korean people will make positive efforts with the fraternal Chinese people to consolidate and develop in depth the traditional DPRK-China friendship and intensify exchange and cooperation in all fields.
					
					 The great successes and brilliant exploit performed by Kim Jong Il in the days of his visit to China will be conveyed down through generations along with the history of the DPRK-China friendship.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Russian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Russian President
 Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Dmitri Medvedev, President of the Russian Federation, on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the victory in the Great Patriotic War.
					 Kim in the message said that the heroic feats performed by the army and people of the Soviet Union in the war to defeat fascism and defend security of the country and world peace would remain long in history. 
					
					 Expressing expectation that the DPRK-Russia relations would develop in the spirit of the joint documents adopted between the two countries, Kim wished the Russian President success in his work.

articles.title: Russian Embassy's Staffs Lay Wreaths
articles.content:
Russian Embassy's Staffs Lay Wreaths
 Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the Russian embassy here laid a wreath before the Liberation Tower Sunday on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of Russia's victory in the Great Patriotic War.
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Ambassador Valery Sukhinin and staff members of the Russian embassy and diplomatic envoys and military attaches of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Amid the playing of the wreath-laying music, the participants placed the wreath and bouquets before the tower and paid silent tribute to the Soviet army soldiers who fell in the battles for the liberation of Korea.
					
					 They also laid a wreath at the cemetery of the fallen Soviet army soldiers in Sadong District and paid silent tribute to the fallen Soviet army soldiers. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the Russian embassy placed bouquets before the statue of the Soviet army soldiers in Nampho on Friday.

articles.title: Opera "A Dream of Red Mansions" Given in Beijing
articles.content:
Opera "A Dream of Red Mansions" Given in Beijing 
						
 Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- A performance of opera "A Dream of Red Mansions" for guests of honor was given at the state grand theatre of Beijing TV on May 7.
					 Present to see the performance on invitation were Li Changchun, standing member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China; Liu Yunshan, member of the Political Bureau, member of the Secretariat and head of the Publicity Department of the C.C., CPC; Liu Yandong, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., CPC and state councilor; and other officials concerned.
					
					 Ambassador Choe Pyong Gwan and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Beijing enjoyed the performance.
					
					 The audience was completely taken with the tested and perfect artistic depiction of performers, beautiful melody touching a chord with the audience, enraptured dances and excellent stage backgrounds. 
					
					 The audience did not spare praises, expressing admiration at the performance of the opera which Korean artistes represented in a peculiar manner by comprehending the voluminous contents of Chinese classic novel "A Dream of Red Mansions".
					
					 The performance continues.

articles.title: Art Works Portraying Kim Il Sung Exhibited
articles.content:
Art Works Portraying Kim Il Sung Exhibited
						
 Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- Fine art pieces depicting President Kim Il Sung dating back to the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle have been exhibited at the Korean Art Gallery. They are Korean painting, pen drawing, woodcut prints, pencil drawing and other works of various forms created during the anti-Japanese war. 
					 Among them is Korean painting "General Kim's commanding order reverberates throughout Changbai valley", which praises Kim Il Sung as a central figure in the national liberation struggle and the invincible and iron-willed commander. Pen drawing "General Kim allures and destroys enemies in Liudaogou" and print "Commander Kim Il Sung mapping out operation" truthfully portray the greatness of Kim Il Sung sweeping the Japanese imperialist aggressors into their graves and instilling confidence in Korea's liberation into the people.
					
					 There are also pen drawing "General Kim making a campfire", mimeographed picture "General Kim patching up shoes of guerrilla members", Korean painting "General Kim giving back cows to peasants in Yaksudong Village", pencil drawing "General Kim having a talk with old villagers" and other works. They depict the noble traits of the President who showed great benevolence for guerrilla members and people, always sharing weal and woe with them.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Prosecution Accused of Indicting Unionists
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Prosecution Accused of Indicting Unionists
 Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- The puppet Seoul Central District Prosecutor's Office of south Korea brought an indictment against 273 members of the Teachers Union and the Government Employees' Union on May 6 on charges of "illegal political activities", according to south Korean KBS.
					 The prosecution took such action on charges that they "joined the Democratic Labor Party and contributed political funds to it."
					
					 Lurking behind the wholesale indictment brought against the unionists by the prosecution with the "elections to local self-governing bodies" at hand is a political aim, trade union organizations declared, expressing the will to fight against it.

articles.title: KPA Praised by British Organizations
articles.content:
KPA Praised by British Organizations
 Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on April 25 on the occasion of the 78th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 The KPA originated from the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army founded by President Kim Il Sung, the statement said, noting that under his leadership the KPA beat the two formidable enemies the U.S. and Japanese imperialists and frustrated the U.S. imperialists' repeated threats of aggression and all their moves to provoke a war.
					
					 The statement recalled that the President developed the KPA into a-match-for-a hundred steel-strong ranks and genuine Juche-type revolutionary armed forces and that it has grown to be an invincible army under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The KPA, having powerful war deterrence, is standing firm at the outpost of the anti-imperialist and class struggle as vanguard of the glorious Songun revolution, the statement stressed.

articles.title: Memorandum of DPRK FM Supported
articles.content:
Memorandum of DPRK FM Supported
 Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a statement on April 30 in support of the memorandum of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK.
					 The global peace and security are directly related to denuclearization, the statement said, adding that the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula is part of the world denuclearization. 
					
					 The statement continued: As far as the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula is concerned, it was spawned as an inevitable consequence of the ceaseless nuclear threat posed to the DPRK by the U.S. for a long time. 
					
					 Noting that the nuclear deterrent built by the DPRK to cope with the U.S. nuclear threat was a self-defensive measure for reacting to "nukes with nukes", the statement held that any country is entitled to have any means to defend itself.
					
					 He voiced full support for the DPRK's proposal for concluding a peace treaty.
